content: around slip_stitch to join 15 4 chain 2 dcinc double_crochet x2 around slip_stitch to join 20 5 chain 2 dcinc double_crochet x3 around slip_stitch to join 25 6 *chain 7 slip_stitch 6 back down the chain slip_stitch into next 3 single_crochet* repeat between * * 8 times after the 9th spine you will only slip_stitch into 2 single_crochet the next part may be a bit fiddley you will slip_stitch down the side of the fin approximately 7 times then fo leave a long tail to sew onto body don t weave in the short end you will use it to tie a knot with the long end after sewing to secure the fin better before weaving in the ends assembly start with the caudal fin pull the point of the body through the small hole of the fin then use the long tail to sew the fin on sewing through all four layers up & then back down tie the two ends into a tight knot then weave in the ends now flatten the body so that the caudal fin is up & down like a shark s tail stuff the eyes lightly sew the eyes on close the folded edges right behind the round of double_crochet make sure you don t sew them over the double_crochet s as that is where you will add the drawstring the esca or lure goes between the eyes half_double_crochet s towards the back with that edge about one row behind the eyes for the dorsal back fin flatten the body back to the way you had it for the tail fin sew the dorsal fin onto the back starting about 2 rounds behind the lure the shortest spine is the front the pectoral side fins are sewn on with the top about even with the bottom of the eye into the same round as the front of the dorsal fin drawstring - 5 5mm hook in body color chain 55 & fo - starting on the bottom of the fish weave the drawstring through the double_crochet s over 2/under 2 i like to use 20mm wood beads on my drawstrings to help keep the bag closed a button would also work or you can just tie the ends for the beads i pull both ends through one bead then put one bead onto the end of each separate string tie a knot in the ends to secure the beads and they work great to hold the bag closed for a button you would pull a strand through each hole then tie a knot into each end to keep the button from falling off
